instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no 20V"  Pulling 0.06A
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had water damage on the audio board.
The main board looks perfect.

no shorts found.
Unit will enable 5v but will not switch to 20v or boot.  Current just sits at 0.06A  "nothing showed up on thermal"  No shorts found.
The 3v3 on the 3215's is present
The LDO's are present
The <SIGNAL>UPC_XB_SPI</SIGNAL> lines show activity when power is applied.

is my  T2 flipped out?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no 20V"  Pulling 0.06A
threads.message:
Liquid on audio board usually damage T2.
Caused by leakage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to data lines, like <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>; check diode mode there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no 20V"  Pulling 0.06A
threads.message: has anyone replaced the T2 now that it's jailbroken? Cloned it to a new CHIP
